content.description:
Muslim Marabout, Engraving by French Artist Visiting West Africa in the 1780sÂ 

The bare-chested marabout wears amulets around his neck and torso and holds a long-stemmed pipe in his right hand.
In the background three men kneel in attitudes of Muslim prayer.
Slavery Images: A Visual Record of the African Slave Trade and Slave Life in the Early African Diaspora (http://www.slaveryimages.org/s/slaveryimages/item/1693)
Marabout is the title used for members of Muslim religious communities or Muslim religious leaders. In this image, the Marabout wears spiritual amulets, a practice common among West African Indigenous spiritual traditions.
content.question: The engraving provides the most direct context for understanding which of the following developments?

choices.label: The increasing importance of griots in West African culture
The creation of Nok terracotta sculptures
The emergence of spiritual practices such as Voodoo
The growth of the Ethiopian Orthodox Church

content.answer: The emergence of spiritual practices such as Voodoo

skill.text: 1.B: Identify and explain the context of a specific event, development, or process.
